headline: How to rewatch the Republican Pennsylvania U.S. Senate debate
author: George Stockburger
sentences:
Here’s how to rewatch the Democratic Pennsylvania U.S. Senate debate
The U.S. Senate Debate was carried on the following stations and websites:

You can follow along on Twitter using the #PASen and watch our post-debate coverage immediately after both on-air and online.
Kathy Barnette, Jeff Bartos, Dave McCormick, Mehmet Oz, and Carla Sands were live at the abc27 studio in Harrisburg in a debate that will be available to rewatch above shortly.
WHTM abc27 News anchor and Capitol Bureau Reporter Dennis Owens and WPXI Anchor Lisa Sylvester will co-host the debate from the abc27 studio in Harrisburg.
Get the latest news on Pennsylvania Politics and the 2022 Election from Your Local Election Headquarters.
The Democratic Party candidates for Senate held a debate on April 21 that can be rewatched on abc27.com.
The debate was broadcasted to all 67 counties in the Keystone State and live-streamed to millions more.
A debate between the Republican candidates for Governor will debate on April 27.
Senator Pat Toomey debated for an hour under the lights in Harrisburg on Monday.
(WHTM) – Five of the Republican Party candidates vying to replace U.S.
Senator from Pennsylvania is scheduled to take place on May 17.
Voters must register to vote by May 2.
